content.rendered:
What is an Aircraft Pilot?

Aircraft Pilots are people who control and navigate aircrafts. Some of the most common aircrafts that they operate are helicopters or planes.

Where does an Aircraft Pilot work?

  • The US military
  • Commercial airlines
  • Small or large airports
  • Farms

How much does an Aircraft Pilot make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Aircraft Pilot is $55K.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Aircraft Pilots?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing Aircraft Pilot jobs.

  • Aeronautical engineering majors
  • General engineering majors
Search Aircraft Pilot job opportunities on Handshake.

Aircraft Pilot skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Aircraft Pilots succeed in their work:

  • Strong technical skills
  • Coordination
  • Team-working skills

What are some common questions about Aircraft Pilots?

Q: Do Air Force Pilots choose their aircraft?

A: There is standard training and certifications that you must pass before being assigned to an aircraft. With every rank that you rise and with more seniority under your belt, comes more opportunity to choose your aircraft.
